Page 2
You are the daughter of Janaka, the 1st of us.
You and the 2nd of us are one. In return for our immense love and affection for you, we hereby grant you the following property in the village of Vegayammapet, as shown in the Schedule below, namely, the property of Pulasakura Satyanarayana, the husband of the 1st of us and the father of the 2nd of us, who passed away with full rights and possession, and therefore, after their death, it has come to us with full rights as per Hindu law and has been registered in the records of the Gram Panchayat in the name of the 1st of us, and since then, we have been free from the house, which is in our possession and possession, and has been demolished, and we have given you the property including all the 64.77 sq. We have transferred all rights to you and have this settlement property in the possession of the first of us. From now on, the first of us shall pay the taxes due on the property as per the schedule, and shall not have any right of donation or sale, and shall not make any encroachments. After the first of us, you shall take possession of the schedule property, pay the taxes, use it as you wish, and enjoy it with all the rights and easements of donation and sale, and you, your son, grandson, and descendants shall enjoy it happily and freely for a period of one month. In this regard, we, our predecessors, and our subjects, will remove all obstacles and disputes arising from any cause whatsoever, at our own expense, and we will be able to remove such obstacles and implement this settlement property for you and your subjects without any hindrance. We hereby declare that this property is our undisputed, unencumber The number, measurements, limits and boundaries are correct and we have full rights over the said property. We have told you, convinced you and made you believe and issued this settlement deed in your name. It is not a government property, it is not an assigned property.
Filing
This property has no allotments as per Andhra Government Act 9/77.
Not done.
Since the schedule property is vacant, M.Notices
1. Pulapa Kuru Sita Niranni
2. P. Durga
Bhavani

sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 231 of 2026, dated 23/Jan/2026, executed by Pulapakura Sitha and Pulapakura Durga Bhavani in favour of Pulapakura Durga Bhavani, [Whereas Donee is Daughter of First Donor and the Donee herself represented as Second Donor], towards the property admeasuring an extent of Item No. 1. 46.27 Sq. Yds., and Item No.2. 18.5 Sq. Yds., bearing house number Dismantled House No. 4-63, comprised in survey number 181-1, situated in Vegayammapeta Village and Grama Panchayath, Ramachandrapuram Mandal, within the District of Konaseema, registered at sub-registrar office Draksharama (403) is bounded as follows: Item No. 1 North by: 17 Fts., In This 2nd Item, Wall Of Pothula Lakshmi South by: 17 Fts., Site Of Chelle Sundaramma East by: 24.6 Fts., Property Of Pulapakula Macharayya West by: 24.6 Fts., House Of Pothula Lakshmi Item No. 2 North by: 9.3 Fts., Site Of Pulapakula Satyanarayana South by: 9.3 Fts., In This 1st Item East by: 18 Fts., Joint Pathway West by: 18 Fts., Wall Of Pothula Lakshmi.
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible. 2. It should be noted that the deed is executed by Donor representing herself as the Donee, thereby acting in a dual capacity, which constitutes a conflict of interest and is legally invalid. Therefore, it is advisable for the F.I. to verify the same and proceed as per its internal policy.
